a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Death rate from indoor air pollution vs. per capita energy use, 2021
Death rates from indoor air pollution are measured as the number of deaths per 100,000 individuals. Primary
energy is based on the substitution method and measured in kilowatt-hours per person.
Per capita energy consumption (kilowatt-hours per person)
Death rate from indoor air pollution (deaths per 100,000 people)
Data source: IHME, Global Burden of Disease (2024) and other sources
